q: " Colin Powell said. "I think he has some tough times ahead, and I think he's had some setbacks." "You know, we didn't elect Superman," Colin Powell added. We elected a human being, Barack Obama , who came in with an idea, with energy, and I think with a more youthful approach to things. Barack Obama has stabilized the U.S. economy, taken on health care and improved U.S. relations with other nations, Colin Powell said, calling last week's visit to Washington by China Barack Obama Hu Jintao "very successful."

In his letter to supporters, Mr. Mike Pence waxed nostalgic about the "highways and byways" of his state and said he planned to cruise those roads in the weeks and months ahead to listen and learn about how Hoosiers think we might best contribute in the years ahead. Mr. Mike Pence 's decision to spurn a White House run will leave many social and fiscal conservatives still seeking a favored candidate. Some engineers seem to be drawn by the work at a smaller company, which offers an opportunity to reshape culture with less corporate bureaucracy and more creative freedom. Facebook has become the cool kid on the block, and now Google wants to prove it can still be cool, too, says Danny Sullivan , who follows both companies closely as editor-in-chief of Search Engine Land. key given to Michael Vick . Richard Hunter showed the council a picture of his black pit bull Mel, used by Michael Vick as a bait dog to train fighting dogs before he was seized by authorities. On Saturday I was horrified to witness Mayor Tom Leppert Pro Tem Dwaine Caraway gleefully proclaiming that a power had been bestowed on him to give the man who tried to kill my dog a key to my city, Richard Hunter said. Richard Hunter called Dwaine Caraway 's action an embarrassment to the city "rouge decision to besmirch the reputation of the city."
